## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

```{r}
1 + 1
```

COMMON IN STATISTICS
Symbol  Name        LaTeX        Typical use
α        alpha       \alpha       Significance level; Type I error rate
β        beta        \beta        Type II error; regression slope in population; power = 1−β
γ        gamma       \gamma       Shape parameter; Euler’s gamma function context
δ        delta       \delta       Small difference/change; effect size (Cohen’s δ)
ε        epsilon     \epsilon     Error term; very small positive quantity
ζ        zeta        \zeta        Rare in stats; number theory (zeta function)
η        eta         \eta         Effect size (η²); learning rate in optimization
θ        theta       \theta       Generic parameter; angle
κ        kappa       \kappa       Agreement measure (Cohen’s κ); curvature/condition number
λ        lambda      \lambda      Rate (Poisson/Exponential); regularization (L1/L2)
μ        mu          \mu          Population mean
ν        nu          \nu          Degrees of freedom
ξ        xi          \xi          Latent/hidden variable; order statistics
π        pi          \pi          Constant ~3.14159; probability of success (sometimes)
ρ        rho         \rho         Population correlation; intraclass corr; Spearman’s rho
σ        sigma       \sigma       Population standard deviation; also noise level
τ        tau         \tau         Kendall’s tau; time constant; precision (1/variance) in Bayes
φ        phi         \phi         Standard normal pdf; golden ratio context (math)
χ        chi         \chi         Chi-square distributions/tests
ψ        psi         \psi         Wave/latent function; digamma (ψ) in advanced stats
ω        omega       \omega       Frequency; long-run limit; effect size (ω²)

UPPERCASE (COMMON)
Symbol  Name        LaTeX        Typical use
Γ        Gamma       \Gamma       Gamma function; gamma distribution normalization
Δ        Delta       \Delta       Difference/change; Laplacian in math
Θ        Theta       \Theta       Asymptotic order (CS); parameter set
Λ        Lambda      \Lambda      Eigenvalue matrix; likelihood ratio statistics
Π        Pi          \Pi          Product operator
Σ        Sigma       \Sigma       Covariance matrix; summation (use ∑ for operator)
∑        Sum         \sum         Summation operator
Φ        Phi         \Phi         Standard normal CDF
Χ        Chi         \Chi         Used in names; Chi-square as χ² (lowercase chi)
Ψ        Psi         \Psi         Vector/function symbol in advanced contexts
Ω        Omega       \Omega       Sample space; asymptotic lower bound; ohms (physics)

LESS COMMON IN STATS (BUT YOU MAY SEE)
Symbol  Name        LaTeX        Typical use
ι        iota        \iota        Identity inclusion; rarely used in stats
ο        omicron     \omicron     Rare
υ        upsilon     \upsilon     Rare in stats
Ξ        Xi          \Xi          Random variable families; transforms
Υ        Upsilon     \Upsilon     Rare
